trans-unit.source: Sets the accelerator table to be used in a GUI window.

seg-source.mrk: Sets the accelerator table to be used in a GUI window.

target.mrk: Sets the accelerator table to be used in a GUI window.

trans-unit.source: A 2 dimensional array holding the accelerator table (See remarks).

seg-source.mrk: A 2 dimensional array holding the accelerator table (See remarks).

target.mrk: A 2 dimensional array holding the accelerator table (See remarks).

trans-unit.source: [optional] Windows handle as returned by GUICreate() (default is the previously used window).

seg-source.mrk: Windows handle as returned by GUICreate() (default is the previously used window).

target.mrk: Windows handle as returned by GUICreate() (default is the previously used window).

trans-unit.source: Accelerator keys are similar to HotKeys, but there are 2 important differences:

seg-source.mrk: Accelerator keys are similar to HotKeys, but there are 2 important differences:

target.mrk: Accelerator keys are similar to HotKeys, but there are 2 important differences:

trans-unit.source: - 1. They are only active when the GUI specified in the function is active which means that, unlike HotKeys, Accelerator keys will not interfere with other running applications.

seg-source.mrk: They are only active when the GUI specified in the function is active which means that, unlike HotKeys, Accelerator keys will not interfere with other running applications.

target.mrk: They are only active when the GUI specified in the function is active which means that, unlike HotKeys, Accelerator keys will not interfere with other running applications.

trans-unit.source: - 2. They cannot fire a function directly - they action their associated control which then fires the function using GUIGetMsg() or GUICtrlSetOnEvent(). If there is no suitable control available in the GUI then a dummy control can be created using GUICtrlCreateDummy.

seg-source.mrk: They cannot fire a function directly - they action their associated control which then fires the function using GUIGetMsg() or GUICtrlSetOnEvent().
If there is no suitable control available in the GUI then a dummy control can be created using GUICtrlCreateDummy.

target.mrk: They cannot fire a function directly - they action their associated control which then fires the function using GUIGetMsg() or GUICtrlSetOnEvent().
If there is no suitable control available in the GUI then a dummy control can be created using GUICtrlCreateDummy.

trans-unit.source: The array passed as a parameter to this function contains the Accelerator keys and the ControlIDs of the associated controls. The array must be defined as Local/Global $aArray[n][2] - where n is the number of Accelerator keys to set:

seg-source.mrk: The array passed as a parameter to this function contains the Accelerator keys and the ControlIDs of the associated controls.
The array must be defined as Local/Global $aArray[n][2] - where n is the number of Accelerator keys to set:

target.mrk: The array passed as a parameter to this function contains the Accelerator keys and the ControlIDs of the associated controls.
The array must be defined as Local/Global $aArray[n][2] - where n is the number of Accelerator keys to set:

trans-unit.source: $aArray[0][1] = Associated ControlID for 1st accelerator, as returned by GUICtrlCreate...

seg-source.mrk: $aArray[0][1] = Associated ControlID for 1st accelerator, as returned by GUICtrlCreate...

target.mrk: $aArray[0][1] = Associated ControlID for 1st accelerator, as returned by GUICtrlCreate...

trans-unit.source: $aArray[n][1] = Associated ControlID for the nth accelerator

seg-source.mrk: $aArray[n][1] = Associated ControlID for the nth accelerator

target.mrk: $aArray[n][1] = Associated ControlID for the nth accelerator

trans-unit.source: Passing this function a non-array parameter will unset all accelerators for the specified winhandle.

seg-source.mrk: Passing this function a non-array parameter will unset all accelerators for the specified winhandle.

target.mrk: Passing this function a non-array parameter will unset all accelerators for the specified winhandle.

trans-unit.source: Set GUIAccelerators for the button controlIDs, these being Ctrl + y and Ctrl + n

seg-source.mrk: Set GUIAccelerators for the button controlIDs, these being Ctrl + y and Ctrl + n

target.mrk: Set GUIAccelerators for the button controlIDs, these being Ctrl + y and Ctrl + n

trans-unit.source: Displays if the button was selected or the hotkey combination Ctrl + y was pressed.

seg-source.mrk: Displays if the button was selected or the hotkey combination Ctrl + y was pressed.

target.mrk: Displays if the button was selected or the hotkey combination Ctrl + y was pressed.

trans-unit.source: Displays if the button was selected or the hotkey combination Ctrl + n was pressed.

seg-source.mrk: Displays if the button was selected or the hotkey combination Ctrl + n was pressed.

target.mrk: Displays if the button was selected or the hotkey combination Ctrl + n was pressed.
